alert.note: Alert for Custer; Fremont (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 5:34PM MDT until August 05 at 9:30PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Fremont County in central Colorado... North Central Custer County in southeastern Colorado... * Until 930 PM MDT. * At 534 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Texas Creek, Cotopaxi and Hillside. This includes the following streams and drainages... Oak Creek, Middle Tallahassee Creek, Tallahassee Creek, Middle Brush Creek, North Brush Creek, South Lake Creek, Arkansas River, Copper Gulch, Carrol Creek, South Brush Creek, Monument Creek, Sandy Creek, Goat Creek, Currant Creek, Brush Creek, Grape Creek, Greenleaf Creek, Fear Creek, Texas Creek, Cottonwood Creek and Swift Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
